entries.section: Tissue slicing via cryostat (marmoset and rhesus macaque)

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Tissue slicing via vibratome (mice and rhesus macaque)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a4tbc","text":"All tissue should be stored in PBS prior to slicing and further processing. Remove tissue and prepare for mounting. For mouse brain, we separate each half hemisphere. Rhesus macaque brain was separated into 4 mm thick coronal blocks. For all other tissue (e.g. liver), remove a 4-5 mm piece of tissue and cut one edge to make a flat surface. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tissue slicing via cryostat (marmoset and rhesus macaque)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dcg3o","text":"All tissue should be stored in PBS prior to slicing and further processing. Remove tissue and incubate in 30% sucrose at   on a shaker. For marmoset tissue, incubate overnight. For rhesus macaque tissue, incubate for 72 hours, changing the 30% sucrose solution after 48 hours. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":121,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dmsu6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"D92C3580F04B11EDBA6F9DE34D2E264D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"53geb","text":"Slice tissue to 50-100 um slice and collect in 24- (mouse) or 6- (rhesus macaque) well plates filled with 1X PBS.
